text: Ancient Ripperdactyl
The largest and most bloodthirsty of Ripperdactyls, their razor-sharp talons can decapitate enemies, leaving a trail of viscera and limbs behind their ferocious assaults.

Ursun's Winter (Elemental Bear)
The Bear God's statue stands atop a mighty frost-crafted construct, embodying dominion over cold and death, intertwining Kislev's fate with Ursun's blessings.

Uratip Vulture
This immense vulture is adorned with the remains of its god's enemies, a black tempest shrouded in mystery and unimaginable cost to tame.

Obsidian War Elephant
Ancient artisans, roused from their crafting, once again mount the majestic war elephants, their banners fluttering as they cleave through countless foes.
Tomb Dragon
Tomb artisans poured generations into carving this perfect creation from a single block of obsidian, now bearing the Tomb Kings high above the world.

Alastar War Lion
Regardless of the enemy's identity or danger, Alastar mounts his war lion, leading charges that would make the Lion Father proud.
Spirit of Grungni
The Spirit of Grungni is a thunderous airship crafted by Dwarven Slayer Engineer Malakai Makaisson.
Yingchuo

Yingchuo is the Moon Empress' personal gift to Hong Ying, a Taeyue Luan rumored to be the Moon Empress' shadow. Only through hearing its cry can the Onyx Crowmen channel the Wind of Yin and transform into a mythical bird.
